attributes.action: Stop foreign workers taking British jobs in culturally important industries
attributes.background: We petition the Government to apply any immigration controls implemented Post Brexit to all industries, even culturally important ones, with very few exceptions even if the company or foreigner is extremely rich. Especially where there are young British people eager to do the jobs with the skills
attributes.additional_details: This must be applied to all, particularly to Sports clubs and especially football. The only exception should be that each club is allowed 1 coach & 1 player to be non Brit. The invasion of football with foreigners is hurting the ability of young Brits to develop & gain experience, this is hurting the national team. There are 100's of talented young Brits who could fill these roles so foreigners aren't required. Culturally significant industries are Sport, Media and Show business.

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: A government review into the feasibility of driverless trains within the UK
attributes.background: We request a government led industry review, working with all train operators/ management and unions into the feasibility of driverless trains in the UK. The current approach where millions of the population are constrained by the availability of train drivers (sickness or strike) is not acceptable
attributes.additional_details:
Driverless technology is being adopted across the car industry (e.g. Google, Nissan and Tesla). This technology on complex, multi vehicle transport routes. 
https://www.cbinsights.com/blog/autonomous-driverless-vehicles-corporations-list/

attributes.action: "Superfast" (Fibre) broadband should be made available to Exchange Only lines
attributes.background: During the current "superfast" broadband rollout, many properties are being excluded because they are not connected to roadside cabinets. When these properties were originally connected to their local telephone exchange, cabinets were not in standard use.
attributes.additional_details:
Current regulations say that the new "superfast" technology must be installed outside exchanges in cabinets. Therefore new cabinets should be installed outside existing exchanges (to comply with current regulations) or the regulations should be changed.

Currently the public money being spent on these projects is done so without public consultation. Homeowners and businesses cannot interact with the organisers implementing the projects to ensure fair distribution.

attributes.action: Require all planes to have a central locking system on their overhead lockers.
attributes.background: Following the incidents in Dubai  and Las Vegas it is clear that passengers cannot be trusted to act responsible during an emergency event on an aeroplane. To mitigate this and protect other passengers overhead lockers should be centrally locked by the pilot during take off and landing.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36985862

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly £580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: Criminalise deliberately or negligently misinforming a planning panel/committee.
attributes.background: It seems wrong to me that such an activity is not already criminal.
attributes.additional_details:
I asked a planning panel committee manager: 

'Am I right in thinking that anyone who intentionally or recklessly misinforms the panel is subject to criminal proceedings?'

and received the reply:
'No, if such a thing was to occur it would not amount to a criminal offence.'

This does not seem right to me.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Compel households to display a sign warning that there is a dog on the premises
attributes.background: Many people may call on a household on a daily basis for legitimate reasons and dog attacks are a significant hazard.  While the number of attacks has fallen after the change in legislation and greater understanding through dog awareness campaigns, it still remains unacceptably high.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, 2660 postmen/women were attacked by dogs in the last year some leading to a permanent disabling injury. As a postwoman myself I have had a dog bite, which fortunately wasn't serious, but have seen many colleagues that were not so lucky.

A simple sign at the entrance to a property and by the letterbox could help significantly. By making anyone calling at a house aware of the presence of a dog, they can take precautions to ensure their own safety and that of the dog living too.

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Free First Aid courses
attributes.background: First Aid courses should be available for free as it is a life skill which all of the public should know. This will encourage the public to be good citizens and respect their society.

attributes.action: Legislate to give MPs the sole right to elect party leaders
attributes.background: Current Conservative and Labour Party rules leave the final choice of party leaders exclusively in the hands of party members. This is neither fair nor democratic. Party members do not represent the full spectrum of the electorate supporting their party at the polls, unlike elected MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
This risks the selection of leaders at the polar ends of their respective parties because party members do not represent the middle ground occupied by most voters. The recent leadership tribulations of both main parties illustrate this only too well. 
Legislation should be introduced in support of representational democracy to make it compulsory for all parties with more than 49 sitting MPs to give their MPs the sole responsibility for electing their leader

attributes.action: Discounted Stamp Duty for First Time Buyers + Include Essex for HTB ISA £450k.
attributes.background: Unfair discrimination for FT Buyers in Essex. No house value is below 250k for Stamp Duty. Also Help to Buy ISA unfair threshold of £250k in Essex doesn't get buy you anything. Essex has similar house prices to London
attributes.additional_details: Average house price in Essex well above Stamp duty and help to buy threshold. This needs to be discussed.

attributes.action: Make the smoking of tobacco in a household with children under 18 an offense.
attributes.background: In England there is already a ban on smoking in a car with children under 18, however smoke can linger within rooms of a home for long periods of time, this and smoke residue that falls on food and surfaces can put children the most at risk of health problems as their lungs are not fully developed.
attributes.additional_details:
"It’s estimated that, every year, second-hand smoke kills over 12,000 people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and the lung disease Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)."
- Cancer Research UK

http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking#qUzJibFS5IwmCGXk.99

attributes.action: New floating national bank holiday in summer linked to hottest, sunniest day
attributes.background: There exists a need for a new national bank holiday between May and August. We propose new no fixed date, merely a floating day linked to the hottest / sunniest day of the year. That way everyone could have today off in the sunshine! This serves as a positive moral boost over unguaranteed weekends
attributes.additional_details: There are precedents of floating days such as Royal events or public mourning. This should be seen as an equal floating day but with a much more positive morale boost for the nation.

attributes.action: If the average temperature of the UK reaches 30ºC, a bank holiday is  declared.
attributes.background: This year it has taken until the 19th July for summer to arrive and for the temperature to surpass 30ºC, the hard working British people deserve better than having to commute and work on such a nice day. We have some of the greatest parks in the world we should use them more.
attributes.additional_details: We already have the least amount of bank holidays in the UK compared to the rest of Europe. (Germany has 13). It is a good excuse for society to come together and enjoy what seems to be last unifying British activity of frolicking in the sun.

attributes.action: ARM must remain a majority UK owned company.
attributes.background: ARM is probably the most successful UK Tech Company. Ownership of this vital sector is disappearing into foreign hands at an alarming rate. The UK Government should hold a golden share.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa May the new Prime Minister has just said some UK vital companies may be protected. ARM is one of these. This should be debated in Parliament at the earliest opportunity.

attributes.action: Use Dog DNA to solve dog pooh problems
attributes.background: Dogs create around 1000 tons of pooh per day in the UK. Current initiatives are not effective in forcing owners to pick up their dogs pooh. As dogs now have to be microchipped, I propose that their DNA is included in the information on the microchip. This in turn can be used to trace the owners.

attributes.action: Total referendum votes per geographic area should not be made public.
attributes.background: An individuals vote in the UK is private and is only public if they choose it to be so. This should also apply too the votes of geographic areas and age groups. So this same consideration for privacy of individuals should apply also to geographic areas and age groups.
attributes.additional_details: There is no reason for this information to be made public or even recorded, except for the media to create drama and a division within the country. When a democracy makes a decision, the result should be the nations result and not multiple results specific to areas of the country, or a age group. Focusing what percentage voted what and where, serves no benefit to the nation, and only divides it. So no longer provide the public with a group to attack, when a vote does not go ones way.

attributes.action: Designated vape only areas where not permitted in doors
attributes.background: People have taken on "vaping" to give up smoking and to have a cleaner healthier lifestyle, some pubs and places of work alow vaping in doors and welcome it where as others do not, then in most cases vapours are forced to use smoking areas exposing themselves to the chemicals and toxins
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see designated vaping areas in places that have designated smoking areas where vaping is not permitted in doors. I don't think its fair that vapers are being exposed to cigarette smoke. They have taken up vaping from smoking for a healthier lifestyle and to have smokers and vapers together in one area is not ideal. I would like to see vapers have same rights as smokers but treated separately.

attributes.action: Train operators should provide more rolling stock to give all commuters a seat
attributes.background: Train operators habitually operate trains with 4 carriages at peak times causing dangerous levels of overcrowding. Many at non-peak times have up to 12 nearly empty carriages.  They justify this to get rolling stock into position. If they were to invest in enough stock this wouldn't be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: This is self evident to thousands of commuters who use the trains everyday and put up with poor customer service. Part of the franchise should enforce investment in rolling stock to fully meet peak demand.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in Boris Johnson as the UK's foreign secretary.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has consistently demonstrated a lack of awareness towards Europe and the rest of the world. Why would we, citizens of the United Kingdom allow this man to represent us in Europe and the rest of the world as our foreign secretary?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: Immediately raise the minimum wage by 10% to counteract the slump in the pound
attributes.background: People on minimum wage - especially those like myself aged between 18 and 21 - struggled to make ends meet as things were. With all imported products risen in price by 10% due to the slump in the pound, we need some support. We the undersigned call on the government to raise NMW by 10%.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the result of the EU referendum, the pound has dropped by more than 10% against the euro and dollar, increasing the price of all imported goods. It is forecast to drop further. This affects those on lower wages a considerable amount. As I am currently being paid £5.30 an hour, any increase in costs could make me unable to support myself. I fear that I may fall into debt and/or become a burden on the state - this is not something I would like to happen to myself or others in my position.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Make the offence of misconduct in a public office statutory, to include MP's.
attributes.background: It is alleged that some MP's knowingly lied about the facts to the public during the recent EU referendum thereby causing those members of the public to vote in a way they would not have done if in possession of the true facts. The current law of misconduct in a public office is unclear.
attributes.additional_details: The current law on misconduct in public office is not statutory,  and there is a limited definition of who holds public office which does not include MP's. The law needs to be placed on statute and MP's should be included in the definition of holders of public office and liable to commit the offence except where parliamentary privilege exists. This would mean that MP's could be prosecuted where they abuse the public's trust in the office holder by, for example, lying in a referendum debate.

attributes.action: War and bombing a country or people must be the last option, not the first.
attributes.background:
The Chilcot report has now made it clear "the UK chose to join the invasion of Iraq"  and "Military action at that time was not a last resort".
 
A step by step process should be adopted and implemented before the country goes to war with a country or a people.
attributes.additional_details:
A law should be introduced that ensures that before any violent engagement all other options are exhausted.

A rushed decision should not be made just to silent the public due to an incident or tragic event but rather full procedures should always be followed and the aftermath of the engagement should be given great consideration. 

A vote in the parliament is not enough and can not justify the loss of millions of lives especially when it is apparent like in the Chilcot report that the UK led by Tony Blair was rushed, mislead and ill-prepared for the aftermath. There must be more public involvement in such  decision making. Full responsibility must be put on the Prime Minster of the time.

attributes.action: Re-commit £1 billion in funding for carbon capture and storage (CCS) technology.
attributes.background: Carbon capture and storage (CCS) takes the CO2 produced by power plants and locks it safely away underground. We need Government investment in this technology if the UK is to have any hope of meeting the carbon targets agreed in Paris 2015 and effectively fighting climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has been promising support for CCS since 2007, and in 2012 opened a commercialization "competition" offering £1 billion in venture capital. The funding was withdrawn in November 2015. 

The latest carbon budget will not enable us to meet Paris targets, but CCS can close the gap. The Energy and Climate Change committee and Oxford climate scientist Dr Myles Allen both recommend the Government develop a clear strategy for development of CCS infrastructure and expertise in the UK.

attributes.action: Reduce basic VAT rate to 15%, with further reduction after we have left the EU
attributes.background:
The 'Leave' camp pointed out that the EU sets minimums for VAT rates. The EU basic rate is a minimum of 15% but the UK is currently higher than this, at 20%.

We can't lower it below 15% until we leave the EU, but we *can* lower it to 15%, and then lower it more after we leave the EU
attributes.additional_details:
When the Leave campaign said that while in the EU, we would be unable to control our VAT rates. This is accurate, the EU sets minimums for different categories.

At the moment, we are still in the EU, so have to abide by those rules. 

However, the basic rate of VAT in the UK is currently 20%. This is 5% more than the EU's minimum basic rate of 15% - meaning that we have control over that 5%. Let's get rid of that 5% that we *do* have control of, and once we have left the EU, reduce it further!

attributes.action: stop councils using loose chippings as surface repair
attributes.background: Councils need to stop wasting money on surface chipping and do repairs to the road as it damage's vehicles

attributes.action: DfE to deliver assessment frameworks for 2016-17 as they were promised by now.
attributes.background: The interim frameworks "support teachers in making robust and accurate judgements for pupils at the end of key stage 2 in 2016" were delivered late to teachers. Plus, they're only for a year. The DfE have been "evaluating options for future years" for over a year and still nothing for 2016-2017.

attributes.action: Publish a database registering all the Brexit questions and current answers.
attributes.background: As we move closer to Brexit we must all be positive and engage with Government on all of the questions arising from exit some will be simple others more complex but the both the Nation and the EU must know the current UK position.
attributes.additional_details:
Today the Scottish First Minister demanded action on the position of EU national living in the UK.
Friday 3 questions were raised in the Scottish Parliament. The position on the EU arrest warrant, EU Student studying in the UK and  one other.
But as we progress there will be many questions which will make there way to a Bill that goes before parliament. All we ask is to be kept in the picture

attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: Home Office should issue temporary travel document to travel from and to UK
attributes.background: Home office take too long to take a decision on naturalisation decision. While it is understandable the time to take the decision, they should be able to issue travel documents so that applicants can travel to their original country in case of an emergency
attributes.additional_details: Applied for my 3 year old son's naturalisation application 3 months back. It is still pending. There is a requirement for him to travel to India but cannot do it as he is still waiting for a decision. I'm requesting Home Office to be able to issue temporary visa do that applicants can travel in case of any emergency out of UK and be able to come back to UK

attributes.action: Create a Political Campaign Descriptions Act.
attributes.background: Political campaigns that make statements and promises in order to encourage the public in electing a political party to power, or to vote in referendums, should be subject to the same strict oversight as product advertising campaigns are. We should no longer accept 'spin' as an excuse for deception.
attributes.additional_details:
After the recent EU referendum, it has come to light that key statements made by the leave campaign were false and deliberately misled a portion of the public into voting 'leave', particularly, the £350m that would be saved if we vote leave.

As consumers, we are protected by the trade descriptions act 1968 which prevents companies from making false claims in their advertising. Political voting is an important right, and parties should be held to account for knowingly making false claims.

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to follow the policy of free trade globally
attributes.background: In this new age the UK needs to apply policies that reflect and encourage commerce throughout all nations and islands of the United Kingdom and to encourage this with all nations we trade with. This will show a willingness for free market economics to promote prosperity globally not just the UK.

attributes.action: If the UK is forced to leave the EU, the government should apply to rejoin it.
attributes.background:
On 23rd June the EU referendum returned a small majority in favour of the UK leaving the EU. As of yet it is still unclear whether or not Article 50 will be invoked and we actually have to leave.

Should the UK be forced to leave the EU then the government should begin proceedings to rejoin it.

attributes.action: Ensure level 3 BTEC's are not equivelant to 3 A levels
attributes.background: According to the board of education, a Level 3 BTEC is equivelent to 3 A- levels. However the amount of work, stress, perserverance and time spent completing A levels is far from on par with that endured from BTEC students.
attributes.additional_details:
'Even students who win places at prestigious Russell Group universities on the back of top results in BTECs are much less likely to gain a first or 2:1 and more than 40 per cent fail to complete their degree course, with many withdrawing because of “academic failure”.'- The Sunday Times.
A- Level students are experienced with high levels of stress and mental endurance due to the courses sat, and so is it just they have to compete for university places that will most probably be dropped out of?

attributes.action: Majority should be of electorate in referenda, with provision for indecision
attributes.background: We call on parliament to ensure that referenda base the majority on the entire electorate rather than on turnout, and have provision for the scenario where the public as a whole is undecided. In which case, our elected MPs must continue the debate and consider rephrasing the question to the public.

attributes.action: Reform this country before deciding on enacting Article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Mass migration was seen as many to be a root cause for dissent with the EU, yet some UK firms advertise exclusively in Eastern European countries to take advantage of cheap labour. Change our laws to prevent this. Any building firm that hires migrant workers to employ the same number of apprentices
attributes.additional_details: Also, boost money into the NHS by properly claiming with the E111 system or enforcing health insurance for non-EU visitors.  In the Oct 2013 yougov report, this could save £500million annually. All UK residents must pay taxes for 12months before being eligible for benefits. This will also empower our youth to get off benefits as most migrants are much less likely to claim benefits. If UK firms must pay UK and non-UK people the same salary, there is much less incentive for mass migration

attributes.action: Organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate immigrants living & working in the UK
attributes.background: Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

attributes.action: Give landlords more power to self evict bad tenants who break their contracts
attributes.background: My husband and I are landlords of one property and have had some terrible tenants who either feel it's ok to not pay rent or flout other parts of the contract. We have just had our rental completely trashed and landlord insurance covers a tiny fraction. We are working class people who work hard.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/Bernard.Bernie.Mac/posts/10154331015367160

attributes.action: Keep the same workers rights as the EU
attributes.background: Keeping the same workers rights as the EU would keep our holiday pay, sick pay, maternity leave, and follow the 48 hour working time directive.

attributes.action: Ask public about immigration before negotiating new EU deals
attributes.background: On June 23rd the UK voted to leave the EU. A number of public figures have suggested which factors swayed voters, but the question asked makes it impossible to know public opinion on specific issues. We believe the government cannot claim a mandate to negotiate a new deal without polling.
attributes.additional_details: Some have claimed that immigration was a key factor in the result, but it is impossible to say for certain that a majority of those who voted leave did so to prevent free movement of people. The government should take steps to more effectively gauge public opinion on the nature of Britain’s exit from the EU, so that it can act on facts, not speculation. The issues of environmental legislation, the EU arrest warrant, and the court of human rights should also be included in the poll.

attributes.action: Bring back half day closing on a Wednesday and close full day Sunday
attributes.background: We should bring back half day and Sunday closing to help the economy and give more people family time as more places are open on the Internet

attributes.action: Change legislation and bring back the 500cc 2 stroke motorcycle engine.
attributes.background: Now that we are coming out of the EU, its about time the large 2 stroke motorcycle engine is brought back to the uk. It makes riding a motorcycle much more fun that a heavy old 4 stroke.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.gizmag.com/honda-two-stroke-with-fuel-injection-patent-filing/38529/
http://www.dirtrider.com/honda-building-efi-controlled-direct-injected-two-stroke

attributes.action: Stop Expatriates Having A Vote On British Issues Such As Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Just over 4.5 million Britons live abroad with approximately 1.3 million of them in Europe. Allowing them to vote on British issues severely alters the results of elections and referendums.
If Britain isn't good enough for them to live or pay Tax in then why should they have a say in how it is run?
attributes.additional_details:
We saw during the EU referendum over a million Spanish expats (selfishly) tried to vote 'stay' in Europe purely because they wanted to keep their NHS benefits abroad! Not for the good of the country.

Sign if you believe British Expats who do not live or pay Tax in the Britain should NOT be able to vote in Britain!
